result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Darrell Phillips was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: NOTICE OF INTENT TO PURSUE POST-CONVICTION RELIEF RECEIVED AND FILED ON 8-12-15.pk
records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 11-06-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by Terry J., the State, defense counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

As to Count 1:
Court ordered defendant to serve  9 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; credit for 13 days served.

As to Count 2:
Court ordered defendant to serve  90  DAYS  in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to the sentence imposed as to Count 1; credit for 13 days served.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis if not already done so

As to both counts:
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for  18  MONTHS with the following conditions:

- Court ordered 30 days in the House of Correction; stayed for the use at the discretion of the probation department.
- Attend and successfully complete an Anger Mgmnt program
- Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment
- Take all prescribed medication
- Comply with any treatment or programming ordered by probation
- AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
- If not on prescribed medication, then Absolute Sobriety
- Random screens
- No drugs without a valid prescription
- No Violent contact with the victim
- Defendant and victim are NOT to reside together without approval of probation agent
- Seek/maintain employment.
- Pay all costs, fees, assessments and surcharges (including the DNA surcharge) during the term of probation.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  
- No contact with firearms
- Attend the probation review hearing on 11-06-2015.

Received and filed:  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

As to Amended Count 1 and Count 2:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the Defendant guilty and enters judgment of conviction into the record forthwith. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Defendant Steven Darrell Phillips in court with attorney Douglas E. Batt.  Kristin M. Schrank appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
On motion of the State, Court orders Count 1 AMENDED as follows:
Battery, a Misdemeanor, contrary to Wisconsin State Stats. 940.19(1)

Defendant Steven Darrell Phillips in court with attorney Alexis Liggins.  Defendant Steven Darrell Phillips in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Count 2.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
